intro: Shonia tristigma subsp. tristigma, commonly known as the slender-leafed shonia, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small shrub characterized by its narrow, aromatic leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The subspecies is distinguished by its slender foliage and specific geographic distribution within its native range.
